name: Joseph Dal Molin
biography: Joseph Dal Molin is an internationally recognized expert in health information technology, open source strategy and community building. He began pioneering the development and application of the open source model in healthcare in 1998, co-founding WorldVistA in 2002 and the Open Source Health Care Alliance in 2000. His accomplishments include: leading the successful development and CCHIT certification of WorldVistA EHR, developing the initial business plan and strategy for the OSCAR primary care EHR and EC funded SPIRIT collaborative portal, and authoring Industry Canada’s of the implications of open source in the public and private sectors. In addition he has authored several health ICT strategy studies, including “Strategies for Successful Patient Portals” for Canada Health Infoway, and other clients such as Siemens, SAP, OECD, IDRC Canada, and UCLA School of Medicine. He is a co-recipient of the 2007 Wired Magazine Rave Award for Medicine and winner of the Linuxmednews Freedom Award. Joseph is currently engaged as chief advisor on open source and VistA EHR strategy to Jordan’s EHS not for profit which is responsible for implementation and support of WorldVistA EHR across the Jordan’s entire public health system.
